member.name: T:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.ChromatographyDataAnalysisException
member.summary: Chromatography data analysis exception type to handle known or expected exceptions that can be displayed to the end user and holds instructions for the user how to resolve the situation

member.name: F:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.ChromatographyDataAnalysisException.ShowMessageFromInnerException
member.summary: Indicates if the message of the inner exception should be added to the error message

member.name: F:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.ChromatographyDataAnalysisException.ShowTryAgain
member.summary: Indicates if the "Please try again" message of an error message should be appended to an error message.

member.name: F:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.ChromatographyDataAnalysisException.HintFurtherInformation
member.summary: Localized error message for a hint to show extra content from an inner exception

member.name: F:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.ChromatographyDataAnalysisException.NullException
member.summary: Localized error message for an error without any information

member.name: F:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.ChromatographyDataAnalysisException.TryAgain
member.summary: Localized error message for the user to try again or contact support

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.ChromatographyDataAnalysisException.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Create an empty chromatography data analysis exception

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.ChromatographyDataAnalysisException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Create a chromatography data analysis exception Note: There is a general policy to separate exception handling and tracing Therefore, no trace will be generated when constructing a chromatography data analysis exception
member.param: Localized message for the end user with information about the problem and instructions how to solve the problem

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.ChromatographyDataAnalysisException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Create a chromatography data analysis exception Note: There is a general policy to separate exception handling and tracing Therefore, no trace will be generated when constructing a chromatography data analysis exception
member.param: Localized message for the end user with information about the problem and instructions how to solve the problem

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.ChromatographyDataAnalysisException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Create a chromatography data analysis exception

member.name: P:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.ChromatographyDataAnalysisException.Message
member.summary: Retrieves the message of the exception plus message from an inner exception, if it exists and if "ShowMessageFromInnerException" = true

member.name: M:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.ChromatographyDataAnalysisException.MakeMessageWithExtraInfo(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an error message with additional specification of the problem
member.param: basic error message, e.g. "An error occurred while doing this."
additional specification of the problem, e.g. the message of an unexpected exception
member.returns: The make message with extra info.

member.summary: Manage activities in traces.

member.name: T:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.TraceBase
member.summary: Basic functions for tracing Features: - maintainance of the trace source - maintainance of event IDs and counters with auto increment - reduced parameter lists for logging traces - info collection for logging exceptions and mini-dump for critical exceptions Usage: - Create a subclass as singelton for a global or module trace source - Use the subclass instance to trace errors, warnings and important information - Link trace sources in app.config with trace listeners - Use ExceptionCritical to trace any unexpected un-catched exceptions at high application layer: Extra info like stack trace and mini-dump will be logged in this case

member.name: F:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.TraceBase.TraceSourceNameRoot
member.summary: Basic Trace Source name for root namespace Needs to be configured in application config file

member.name: F:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.TraceBase.SynchronizationRoot
member.summary: The synchronization root.

member.name: F:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.TraceBase.internalTraceSource
member.summary: The internal trace source.

member.name: F:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.TraceBase.traceSource
member.summary:
protected trace source - needs to be initialized by each module, when inheriting from this class
The recommended practice is to use the name of the application for the source name. See Microsoft help for SYSTEM.DIAGNOSTICS.TRACESOURCE constructor

member.name: P:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.TraceBase.CountAll
member.summary: log counter for all event types - also used as info trace event ID

member.name: P:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.TraceBase.CountErrors
member.summary: Error log counter

member.name: P:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.TraceBase.CountInfo
member.summary: Information log counter

member.name: P:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.TraceBase.CountInternal
member.summary: log counter for trace internal event types, used when an internal error occurres when trying to trace Does not contribute to CountAll Note: A non-zero internal count indicates that an internal error has occurred, which may be tracked in the internal trace listener

member.name: P:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.TraceBase.CountWarnings
member.summary: Warning log counter

member.name: P:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.TraceBase.Source
member.summary:
Trace source of this module non-public to avoid trace logs without using the counters / event IDs
The recommended practice is to use the name of the application for the source name.

member.summary: Closes the trace.

member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.Properties.Resources.Error_HintFurtherInformation
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The following information might help: {0}.

member.name: P:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.Properties.Resources.Error_NullException
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to An error without information occurred..

member.name: P:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.Properties.Resources.Error_TryAgain
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Please try again. Please contact your vendor if the problem still occurs!.

member.name: P:Agilent.OpenLab.Framework.Diagnostics.Properties.Resources.Trace_InternalError
member.summary:
Looks up a localized string similar to *** Cannot send trace information to the listener as configured for the application.
Please check your user account control level, administrator privileges or disk write access. Administrator privileges are required to create an event source for the windows application event log. Disk write access and existence of the target folder are required for writing trace files on disk. Your application installation might have been incomplete.
Please contact your system administrator!
*** Problem details: [rest of string was truncated]";.
